Hedy Lamarr


A 1940s shot of Lamarr

All creative people want to do the unexpected.- Hedy Lamarr


Technologically Beautiful

Hedy Lamarr was an amazing actress but what most people dont know is that she was a scientist that helped in creating technologies during WWII.

Inovations

  • Developed a radio guidance system for Allied torpedoes.
  • A spread spectrum technology that led to the development of GPS, Bluetooth, and Wi-Fi.
  • Sketched ideas to make wings on planes less square and more efficient.

With no formal training she was self-taught and liked to work in her spare time on various hobbies and inventions.

Stunningly Artistic

Typecast as the standard glamorous she often played opposite the era's most famous leading men.

Leading Lady

  • Lamarr made her American film debut in Algiers
